items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street's main indexes closed higher on Thursday after the latest inflation data reinforced expectations for a 25-basis point rate cut by the Federal Reserve, while Moderna's weak revenue forecast made it the S&P 500's biggest percentage loser.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty Smash A New Record This Friday The 13th? HCL Tech, Patanjali In Focus| Opening Bell
items.description:
Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty surged over 1.5% in the fag end of September 12 session to touch an all-time high of 83,116 and 25,433, respectively, tracking strong global cues. All sectors popped in green, with auto, metal, and energy stocks leading majority of the gains. The optimism came on the back of soft US inflation print, which was at a 3-year low of 2.5 percent in August, clearing the way for Federal Reserve to start its rate easing cycle from next week. Swap markets are pricing in about 85 percent change of a 25 basis point rate cut in the September 18 meeting, significantly up from 60 percent a week ago, showed CME-FedWatch tool. This morning global cues are mixed with Wall Street clocking a 4th straight day of gains and Asian markets edging lower in early trade. The GIFT Nifty is hinting at a positive start for our markets. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Shibani Kurian- Head - Equity Research and Fund Manager, Kotak Mahindra AMC.
 #sharemarket   #stockmarket #marketopening

items.title: Weekly Tactical Pick: Why the time is just right to check in to this hotel
items.description: We expect a pick-up in occupancies for LMNT from H2FY25. A seasonally strong period (more holidays, greater arrival of foreign tourists, and pleasant weather conditions) would drive growth.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex, Nifty firm at pre-open; Nazara Tech, Patanjali, HG Infra in focus
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: For traders, Nifty is a buy between 25,200-25,300 with targets up to 26,100, while Bank Nifty offers aggressive targets up to 55,000. Jindal Steel & Power remains a top pick for a bullish rebound, says Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities.

items.title: HG Infra stock surges 5% as firm secures Rs 716 crore Central Railway project
items.description: Earlier this week, HG Infra won another project worth Rs 780 crore from the Ministry of Road Transport & Highways for the upgradation of NH-47.

items.title: Nazara Tech shares rise 4% after Rs 982-crore investment in PokerBaazi
items.description: Nazara Technologies will initially acquire a 47.7 percent stake in Moonshine Technology (Baazi Games) for Rs 831.5 crore in a secondary transaction from existing shareholders

items.title: Bharti Hexacom stock hits record high, rises 7% as Jefferies upgrades to 'buy'
items.description: The brokerage has increased its FY26 and 27 revenue and EBITDA estimates by 5-12 percent. Bharti Hexacom's higher EBITDA and free cash flow to equity (FCFE) CAGR of 25 percent and 66 percent, respectively.

items.description: The three-day fall in Granules India was triggered after the US Food and Drug Administration issued a Form 483 with six observations for the companyâ€™s Gagillapur manufacturing site.

items.title: Agri Picks Report September 13, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, India's soymeal exports rose 119% on year in August to 153,000 tn from 70,000 tn a year ago, the Soybean Processors Association of India said in a release.

items.title: Brokerages expect India's retail inflation to ease from Sept, but rate cut cycle may lag
items.description: India's retail inflation inched up to 3.65 percent year-on-year in August but stayed comfortably within the RBI's 4 percent tolerance band

items.title: Bajaj Auto shares hit record high, rallies for 5th consecutive session on upbeat sentiment
items.description: The upbeat sentiment stems from the Union Cabinet approval of the PM E-Drive scheme with an outlay of Rs 10,900 crore for two years to bolster the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) in India.

items.title: Tata Motors sees mutual funds pick up shares worth Rs 12,000 crore in August
items.description: The MFs bought around 11 crore shares of the automaker in August after selling approximately 1.6 crore shares in July. Out of 37 mutual funds that have invested in Tata Motors, 32 increased their holdings in August, while five chose to dilute part of their stakes.
